page.title: 12A CHILDS DAY (1) JULY 1985
page.content: {Our school is Fletching Primary School At 8.45 a.m. the bell goes. Mrs Alexander tells us to be quiet. When we go in we tell each other what we watched on television last night. We have the register and do some handwriting. At 9 a.m. it is Assembly and Emma gives out the hymn books. There are 49 children in our school and they come into our room. Mrs Baileys class sit on the floor and Miss Longs class sit on the spare chairs. We have a story and hymn and a prayer. Everybody goes back to their classes and we are left on our own to work. Playtime is 10.25 when we go on the grass. i play " last one on the wall is it" { A Bishop }
